episodeTitle: The Return of the Phoenix! The Dream of the Pirate Flag Sworn to a Friend!
episodeTitleJapanese: 不死鳥ふたたび！友に誓う海賊旗の夢
episodeTitleRomanized: Fushichō Futatabi! Tomo ni Chikau Kaizokuki no Yume
description: The Straw Hats escape their confinement and engage the Accino Family in decisive rematches throughout Lovely Land. As victories mount in favor of the Straw Hats, Puzzle's fighting spirit returns, and he confronts Campacino. However, the commotion awakens Don Accino, while Robin faces capture by Lil.

events.title: Straw Hats Escape Confinement
events.description: Thanks to Zoro's efforts, the formerly captured Straw Hats manage to escape their confinement and get outside of the holding area where they were imprisoned by the Accino Family.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the counterattack phase where the Straw Hats turn the tables on the Accino Family and fight to reclaim their stolen Jolly Roger.

events.title: Rematch Battles Begin
events.description: The Straw Hats encounter the Accino Family members once again outside of their confinement and engage them in rematch battles throughout Lovely Land. Each crew member faces off against their previous opponents with renewed determination.
events.significance: Sets up multiple simultaneous battles where the Straw Hats demonstrate their superior combat abilities and determination to reclaim their stolen flag.

events.title: Franky and Chopper Defeat Hockera
events.description: Using teamwork and Franky's Fresh Fire attack, Franky and Chopper successfully defeat Hockera, the Accino Family member who commands local fauna including trained attack penguins. Chopper uses his Rumble Ball and Guard Point transformation during the battle.
events.significance: First victory in the rematch battles, demonstrating the Straw Hats' improved coordination and showing Franky's growing integration with the crew.

events.title: Nami and Sanji Overcome Arbell and Salchow
events.description: Nami and Sanji team up to defeat the married couple Arbell and Salchow. Despite Sanji's tendency to fall for Arbell's charms, the duo successfully overcomes the collaborative fighters of the Accino Family.
events.significance: Demonstrates the battle partnership between Nami and Sanji, with Sanji's weakness for women creating both comedic moments and tactical challenges.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Brindo
events.description: After a protracted battle, Luffy overpowers Brindo and smashes him right back into Lovely Land. This decisive victory eliminates one of the twin brothers from the Accino Family's fighting force.
events.significance: Showcases Luffy's combat prowess and his determination to reclaim the Straw Hats' stolen Jolly Roger from the bounty hunter family.

events.title: Puzzle's Fighting Spirit Returns
events.description: Puzzle, the captain of the Phoenix Pirates, gains newfound confidence and fighting spirit after witnessing the Straw Hats' determination and remembering his fallen vice-captain Vigaro's sacrifice. He removes his bandages, revealing his phoenix-shaped scar, and decides to fight for his crew's flag.
events.significance: Represents a major character development moment for Puzzle, paralleling Luffy's determination and embodying the theme of dreams and fighting for one's pirate flag. This is the titular 'Phoenix Returns' moment.

quotes.text: A pirate's flag represents their dreams and their bond with their crew. I won't let it be taken without a fight!
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle regaining his resolve to fight for the Phoenix Pirates' Jolly Roger

events.title: Puzzle Confronts Campacino
events.description: Showing new found confidence, Puzzle confronts Campacino, one of the twin brothers of the Accino Family. This marks Puzzle's return to active combat after his recovery from the devastating defeat in the New World.
events.significance: Demonstrates Puzzle's renewed determination and sets up his character arc of overcoming trauma and regaining his will to fight.

events.title: Don Accino Awakens
events.description: All the ruckus from the battles arouses Don Accino, the patriarch of the Accino Family and user of the Atsu Atsu no Mi Devil Fruit. His awakening signals the beginning of the final confrontation with the most powerful member of the bounty hunter family.
events.significance: Introduces the main antagonist's return to the conflict, escalating the stakes significantly as the Straw Hats must now face the wielder of the heat-heat fruit who can reach temperatures of 10,000 degrees.

events.title: Robin Taken Hostage by Lil
events.description: Robin is taken hostage by Lil, the second daughter of the Accino Family who can command Domo Penguins. Lil tries to coerce Robin into promising to stay in Lovely Land as her 'new big sister,' using vines to trap her.
events.significance: Creates a separate conflict thread and demonstrates Lil's emotional need for family connection, adding depth to the Accino Family characters beyond simple antagonists.

events.title: Zoro Finds Don Accino's Room
events.description: After getting lost throughout Lovely Land's mansion, visiting kitchens, toy rooms, and pantries, Zoro finally manages to find Don Accino's room, setting up the confrontation with the family patriarch.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief through Zoro's notorious poor sense of direction while advancing the plot toward the final battle. Classic Zoro moment.

quotes.text: A pirate's flag represents their dreams and their bond with their crew. I won't let it be taken without a fight!
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle regaining his resolve to fight for the Phoenix Pirates' Jolly Roger

themes.description: The episode strongly emphasizes the symbolic importance of a pirate's flag as a representation of their dreams and bonds. Puzzle's renewal of fighting spirit mirrors Luffy's unwavering determination.
themes.symbolism: The Jolly Roger represents not just a crew's identity but their shared dreams and the promises made between crewmates. The phoenix motif represents rebirth and rising from defeat.

themes.description: Puzzle's character arc deals with overcoming the trauma of defeat and the loss of his vice-captain Vigaro in the New World. His return to fighting represents healing and renewed purpose.
themes.symbolism: The phoenix scar on Puzzle's forehead symbolizes his ability to rise from the ashes of defeat.

themes.description: The episode showcases teamwork among the Straw Hats as they work together to overcome the Accino Family, with pair battles demonstrating their trust in each other.
themes.symbolism: The stolen flags represent the bonds between crew members that the antagonists fail to understand.

characterSpotlights.development: Puzzle overcomes his defeatist mindset after witnessing the Straw Hats' determination. He remembers his fallen vice-captain Vigaro and regains his fighting spirit, removing his bandages to reveal his phoenix scar and confronting Campacino.
quotes: A pirate's flag represents their dreams and their bond with their crew. I won't let it be taken without a fight!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues to demonstrate his unwavering determination to reclaim the Straw Hats' stolen Jolly Roger, inspiring Puzzle through his actions.
Zoro leads the crew's escape but comically gets lost throughout Lovely Land before finally finding Don Accino's room.

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-only filler. The Ice Hunter Arc does not appear in the manga at all.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the midpoint of the Ice Hunter Arc (episode 8 of 10 in the arc).

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The title 'The Phoenix Returns' refers to Puzzle's renewal of fighting spirit, with his phoenix-shaped scar representing his ability to rise from defeat like the mythical phoenix rising from ashes.
Episode 333 aired without an ending theme, as ending themes were omitted from episode 279 onwards until episode 1071, with opening themes extended from 110 to 150 seconds instead.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Zoro's tendency to get lost is a running gag throughout the series, and this episode features it prominently as he wanders through kitchens, toy rooms, and pantries before finding Don Accino's room.
The Ice Hunter Arc is one of the longest filler arcs in One Piece at 10 episodes, second only to the G-8 Arc's 11 episodes.

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki
